text: For some reason Grandia 2 just didn't click with me. The first game was nice, but this one simply didn't get me immersed and caring about the characters.

text: @MarioSoundtrack Please if you can, even in an dreamcast emulator play this game, is a must for jrpg fans, and dont play the PS2 ver. is a mess
author: Kevin Mejia

text: Love Grandia! The title theme of Grandia is by far one of my favorite title screen themes other than Xenosaga!
author: Leonhart

text: I didn't have a very good time playing this game. It felt poorly put together and extra long for no reason. Especially the last 1 or 2 hours of the game just dragged and dragged. Yet at the same time I played it everyday after work until i beat it. I loved the battle system, that's for sure. And the music was great. But I hate voice acting in videogames and I couldn't really attach myself to any of the characters, they were all pretty lame. I beat it once, I enjoyed playing it for the most part, but I would never play it again.
author: Jared Silvestri

text:

text: I completely agree, Iwadare needs more work in RPGs. Though of course he's still plenty busy with the Ace Attorney soundtracks, I would love to see another RPG soundtrack with him at the helm. This is an awesome song by the way. Didn't realise before how good it was.

text: Sigh. I love this game. The dialogue was super interesting the whole way through. I need more games like that...

author: Regin Leif

text: Firstttttt
author: Taein Ko

text: Just your typical (and always awesome) Iwadare town theme. Upbeat, great sound quality, cheesy synths. Love it. We need more RPGs with his music, I find him to be a vastly underrated composer. I greatly miss the Grandia series, 1&2 both being amongst my favorite RPGs of all time.
author: SupraDarky

text: Is Grandia I worth playing? I always felt II was more superior because of the better voice acting.
author: Tyler Ness

text:
@Tyler Ness
Absolutely! Although yes, Grandia II had the better voice acting and dialogue, Grandia I has a greater sense of adventure with just as many awesome tunes, great combat and progression, and a simple, but mature story with very lovable characters. If you enjoyed Grandia II, you will love Grandia I even more.
author: Medal Melodies

text: @Tyler Ness more superior... >_>
author: EldestSauce

text: @SupraDarky Totally agree! I miss this series, it was great! Loved the system and the characters, this game had created it's own world and lore :)
author: Kyroyal
